009package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.isSquare;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.sameSize;
013
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
017
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * Solves the generalized eigenproblem of the form A x = &lambda; B x, for
023 * square matrices A, B.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * This implementation was ported from original EISPACK code [1] using a finite
027 * state machine concept [2] to untangle Fortran's GOTO statements (which are
028 * not available in Java), with some inspirations from this <a href=
029 * "https://github.com/accord-net/framework/blob/development/Sources/Accord.Math/Decompositions/GeneralizedEigenvalueDecomposition.cs">
030 * C# implementation</a>. See
031 * <a href="https://mipav.cit.nih.gov/">mipav.cit.nih.gov</a> (file
032 * {@code gov.nih.mipav.model.structures.jama.GeneralizedEigenvalue.java}) for
033 * another Java implementation based on EISPACK.
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * <p>
037 * Note: Results have limited accuracy. For some reason the first
038 * eigenvalue/-vector (k=0) is reasonably accurate, but the remaining ones are
039 * not. If matrices A, B are symmetric and B is positive definite, better use
040 * {@link GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition} instead, which is more
041 * accurate.
042 * </p>
043 * 
044 * <p>
045 * [1] http://www.netlib.no/netlib/eispack/ <br>
046 * [2] D. E. Knuth, "Structured Programming with Goto Statements", Computing
047 * Surveys, Vol. 6, No. 4 (1974).
048 *
049 * @author WB
050 * @version 2022/06/21
051 * @see GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition
052 */
053public class GeneralizedEigenDecomposition implements RealEigenDecomposition {
054        // TODO: Check complex-valued eigenvectors.
055        
056        static boolean VERBOSE = false;
057
058        private int n;
059        private double[] alphaR;
060        private double[] alphaI;
061        private double[] beta;
062        private double[][] Z;
063
064        /**
065         * Constructor.
066         * @param A first matrix
067         * @param B second matrix
068         */
069        public GeneralizedEigenDecomposition(RealMatrix A, RealMatrix B) {
070                this(A.getData(), B.getData());
071        }
072
073        /**
074         * Constructor.
075         * @param A first matrix
076         * @param B second matrix
077         */
078        public GeneralizedEigenDecomposition(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
079                if (!isSquare(A) || !isSquare(B) || !sameSize(A, B)) {
080                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrices A, B must be square and of same size");
081                }
082
083                this.n = A.length;
084                this.alphaR = new double[n];
085                this.alphaI = new double[n];
086                this.beta = new double[n];
087                this.Z = new double[n][n];
088                
089                // a, b are modified by EISPACK routines:
090                double[][] a = Matrix.duplicate(A);
091                double[][] b = Matrix.duplicate(B);             
092                boolean matz = true;
093
094                QZHES.qzhes(a, b, matz, Z);
095                int ierr = QZIT.qzit(a, b, 0, matz, Z);
096                if (ierr >= 0) {
097                        throw new RuntimeException("limit of 30*n iterations exhausted for eigenvalue " + ierr);
098                }
099                QZVAL.qzval(a, b, alphaR, alphaI, beta, matz, Z);
100                QZVEC.qzvec(a, b, alphaR, alphaI, beta, Z);
101        }
102
103        /**
104         * Returns a vector with the real parts of the eigenvalues.
105         * 
106         * @return the real parts of the eigenvalues
107         */
108        @Override
109        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
110                double[] eval = new double[n];
111                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
112                        eval[i] = alphaR[i] / beta[i];
113                }
114                return eval;
115        }
116
117        @Override
118        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
119                return alphaR[k] / beta[k];
120        }
121        
122        /**
123         * Returns a vector with the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues.
124         * 
125         * @return the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
126         */
127        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
128                double[] eval = new double[n];
129                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
130                        eval[i] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
131                return eval;
132        }
133
134        /**
135         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column
136         * vectors.
137         * TODO: not implemented/checked for complex eigenvalues yet!
138         * 
139         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
140         */
141        @Override
142        public RealMatrix getV() {
143                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Z);
144        }
145
146        /**
147         * Returns the specified eigenvector.
148         * TODO: not implemented for complex eigenvalues yet!
149         * 
150         * @param k index
151         * @return the kth eigenvector
152         */
153        @Override
154        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
155                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(Matrix.getColumn(Z, k));
156        }
157        
158        /**
159     * Returns whether the calculated eigenvalues are complex or real.
160     * The method performs a zero check on each element of the
161     * {@link #getImagEigenvalues()} array and returns {@code true} if any
162     * element is not equal to zero.
163     *
164     * @return {@code true} if any of the eigenvalues is complex, {@code false} otherwise
165     */
166        @Override
167        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
168                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
169                        if (alphaI[i] != 0.0) {
170                                return true;
171                        }
172                }
173                return false;
174        }
175
176        /**
177         * Returns the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix D.
178         * TODO: check complex case!
179         * @return the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix
180         */
181        @Override
182        public RealMatrix getD() {
183                double[][] x = new double[n][n];
184
185                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
186                {
187                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++)
188                                x[i][j] = 0.0;
189
190                        x[i][i] = alphaR[i] / beta[i];
191                        if (alphaI[i] > 0)
192                                x[i][ i + 1] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
193                        else if (alphaI[i] < 0)
194                                x[i][ i - 1] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
195                }
196
197                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(x);
198        }
199        
200        // ----------------------------------------------------------
201        
202        // unused methods from 
203        // https://github.com/accord-net/framework/blob/development/Sources/Accord.Math/Decompositions/GeneralizedEigenvalueDecomposition.cs
204        
205        /**
206         * This method checks if any of the generated betas is zero. It does not says
207         * that the problem is singular, but only that one of the matrices 
208         * A, B is singular.
209         * 
210         * @return true if A or B is singular
211         */
212        public boolean isSingular() {
213                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
214                        if (beta[i] == 0)
215                                return true;
216                }
217                return false;
218        }
219
220        /**
221         * Returns true if the eigenvalue problem is degenerate (i.e., ill-posed).
222         * 
223         * @return true if degenerate
224         */
225        public boolean IsDegenerate() {
226                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
227                        if (beta[i] == 0 && alphaR[i] == 0)
228                                return true;
229                }
230                return false;
231        }
232
233        // ----------------------------------------------------------
234
235
236//      public static void main(String[] args) {
237//

296//                      System.out.println("res = "+ Arrays.toString(res.toArray()));   // L - R must be 0

302
303/*

308b = 
309{{10.000000000, 2.000000000, 7.000000000}, 
310{2.000000000, 12.000000000, 3.000000000}, 
311{7.000000000, 3.000000000, 15.000000000}}

343// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
344
345abstract class QZHES {
346        
347        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
348        
349        /**
350         * <p>
351         * This subroutine is the first step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized
352         * matrix eigenvalue problems, SIAM J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256 (1973) by Moler
353         * and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the original version
354         * (dated August 1983).
355         * </p>
356         * <p>
357         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real general matrices and reduces one of
358         * them to upper Hessenberg form and the other to upper triangular form using
359         * orthogonal transformations. It is usually followed by qzit, qzval and,
360         * possibly, qzvec.
361         * </p>
362         * <p>
363         * On output:
364         * </p>
365         * <ul>
366         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to upper hessenberg form. The
367         * elements below the first subdiagonal have been set to zero.</li>
368         * 
369         * <li><strong>b</strong> has been reduced to upper triangular form. The
370         * elements below the main diagonal have been set to zero.</li>
371         * 
372         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations
373         * if matz has been set to true. Otherwise, <strong>z</strong> is not
374         * referenced.</li>
375         * </ul>
376         * 
377         * 
378         * @param a    contains a real general matrix.
379         * @param b    contains a real general matrix.
380         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
381         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
382         *             otherwise.
383         * @param z    on output, contains the product of the right hand transformations if matz
384         *             has been set to true. Otherwise, z is not referenced.
385         */
386        static void qzhes(double[][] a, double[][] b, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
387                
388                final int n = a.length;
389                
390                int i, j, k, l, nm1, nm2;
391                double r, s, t;
392                int l1;
393                double u1, u2, v1, v2;
394                int lb, nk1;
395                double rho;
396        
397                // initialize z (with identity matrix)
398                if (matz) {
399                        for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
400                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
401                                        z[i][j] = 0.0;
402                                }       //      L2
403                                z[j][j] = 1.0;
404                        }       // L3
405                }
406        
407                // L10: reduce b to upper triangular form
408                if (n <= 1) {
409                        return;
410                }
411                
412                nm1 = n - 1;    // TODO: check!!
413                
414                for (l = 0; l < nm1; l++) {
415                        l1 = l + 1;
416                        s = 0.0;
417        
418                        for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
419                                s = s + Math.abs(b[i][l]);
420                        }       // L20
421        
422                        if (s != 0.0) {         
423                                s = s + Math.abs(b[l][l]);
424                                r = 0.0;
425                                for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
426                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] / s;
427                                        r = r + b[i][l] * b[i][l];
428                                }       // L25
429                
430                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(r), b[l][l]);
431                                b[l][l] = b[l][l] + r;
432                                rho = r * b[l][l];
433                
434                                for (j = l1; j < n; j++) {
435                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
436                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
437                                                t = t + b[i][l] * b[i][j];
438                                        }       //L30
439                                        t = -t / rho;
440                                        
441                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
442                                                b[i][j] = b[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
443                                        }       // L40
444                                        
445                                }       // L50
446                
447                                for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
448                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
449                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
450                                                t = t + b[i][l] * a[i][j];
451                                        }       // L60
452                                        
453                                        t = -t / rho;
454                                        
455                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
456                                                a[i][j] = a[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
457                                        }       // L70
458                                        
459                                }       // L80
460                
461                                b[l][l] = -s * r;
462                                for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
463                                        b[i][l] = 0.0;
464                                }       // L90
465                        
466                        }       // end if               
467                }       // L100
468        
469                // reduce a to upper Hessenberg form, while keeping b triangular
470                if (n == 2) {
471                        return;
472                }
473                nm2 = n - 2;
474                
475                for (k = 0; k < nm2; k++) {
476                        nk1 = nm1 - k - 1; // = n - 2 - k;
477        
478                        // for l=n-1 step -1 until k+1 do
479                        for (lb = 0; lb < nk1; lb++) {
480                                l = n - lb - 2;                                 // TODO: check!!
481                                l1 = l + 1;
482        
483                                // zero a(l+1,k)
484                                s = Math.abs(a[l][k]) + Math.abs(a[l1][k]);
485                                if (s == 0.0) {
486                                        continue;       // goto 150
487                                }
488                                u1 = a[l][k] / s;
489                                u2 = a[l1][k] / s;
490                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1); 
491                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
492                                v2 = -u2 / r;
493                                u2 = v2 / v1;
494        
495                                for (j = k; j < n; j++) {
496                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
497                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
498                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
499                                }       // L110
500        
501                                a[l1][k] = 0.0;
502        
503                                for (j = l; j < n; j++) {
504                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
505                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
506                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
507                                }       // L120
508        
509                                // zero b(l+1,l)
510                                s = Math.abs(b[l1][l1]) + Math.abs(b[l1][l]);
511                                if (s == 0.0) {
512                                        continue;       // go to 150
513                                }
514                                u1 = b[l1][l1] / s;
515                                u2 = b[l1][l] / s;
516                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
517                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
518                                v2 = -u2 / r;
519                                u2 = v2 / v1;
520        
521                                for (i = 0; i <= l1; i++) {
522                                        t = b[i][l1] + u2 * b[i][l];
523                                        b[i][l1] = b[i][l1] + t * v1;
524                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] + t * v2;
525                                }       // L130
526        
527                                b[l1][l] = 0.0;
528        
529                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
530                                        t = a[i][l1] + u2 * a[i][l];
531                                        a[i][l1] = a[i][l1] + t * v1;
532                                        a[i][l] = a[i][l] + t * v2;
533                                }       // L140
534        
535                                if (matz) {
536                                        for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
537                                                t = z[i][l1] + u2 * z[i][l];
538                                                z[i][l1] = z[i][l1] + t * v1;
539                                                z[i][l] = z[i][l] + t * v2;
540                                        }       // L145
541                                }
542                        }       // L150
543                }       // L160
544        
545        } // end of qzhes
546
547}
548
549//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
550
551abstract class QZIT {
552        
553        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
554
555        /**
556         * <p>
557         * This subroutine is the second step of the qz algorithm for solving
558         * generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10,
559         * 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart, as modified in technical note NASA TN
560         * D-7305(1973) by Ward. 
561         * This description has been adapted from the original version
562         * (dated August 1983).
563         * </p>
564         * <p>
565         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in upper
566         * Hessenberg form and the other in upper triangular form. It reduces the
567         * Hessenberg matrix to quasi-triangular form using orthogonal transformations
568         * while maintaining the triangular form of the other matrix. It is usually
569         * preceded by qzhes and followed by qzval and, possibly, qzvec.
570         * </p>
571         * <p>
572         * On output:
573         * </p>
574         * <ul>
575         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to quasi-triangular form. The elements 
576         * below the first subdiagonal are still zero and no two consecutive subdiagonal
577         * elements are nonzero.</li>
578         * 
579         * <li><strong>b</strong> is still in upper triangular form, although its elements have been altered.
580         * the location b(n,1) is used to store eps1 times the norm of b for later use
581         * by qzval and qzvec.
582         * 
583         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations (for both steps) if
584         * matz has been set to true.</li>
585         * </ul>
586         * 
587         * 
588         * @param a    contains a real upper hessenberg matrix.
589         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix.
590         * @param eps1 is a tolerance used to determine negligible elements. eps1 = 0.0
591         *             (or negative) may be input, in which case an element will be
592         *             neglected only if it is less than roundoff error times the norm
593         *             of its matrix. If the input eps1 is positive, then an element
594         *             will be considered negligible if it is less than eps1 times the
595         *             norm of its matrix. A positive value of eps1 may result in faster
596         *             execution, but less accurate results.
597         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
598         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
599         *             otherwise.
600         * @param z    contains, if matz has been set to true, the transformation matrix
601         *             produced in the reduction by qzhes, if performed, or else the
602         *             identity matrix. If matz has been set to false, z is not
603         *             referenced.
604         * @return -1 for normal return, j if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted
605         *         while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.
606         */
607        static int qzit(double[][] a, double[][] b, double eps1, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
608
609                final int n = a.length;
610                
611                int i, j, k, l = 0;
612                double r, s, t, a1 = 0, a2 = 0, a3 = 0;
613                int k1, k2, l1 = 0, ll;
614                double u1, u2, u3;
615                double v1, v2, v3;
616                double a11 = 0, a12, a21 = 0, a22, a33 = 0, a34 = 0, a43 = 0, a44 = 0;
617                double b11 = 0, b12, b22 = 0, b33, b34 = 0, b44;
618                int na = 0, en, ld = 0;
619                double ep;
620                double sh = 0;
621                int km1, lm1 = 0;
622                double ani, bni;
623                int ish = 0, itn, its = 0, enm2 = 0, lor1;
624                double epsa, epsb, anorm, bnorm;
625                int enorn;
626                boolean notlas;
627        
628                int ierr = -1;          // no error 
629        
630                // compute epsa and epsb
631                anorm = 0.0;
632                bnorm = 0.0;
633                              
634                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
635                        ani = 0.0;
636                        if (i != 0) {
637                                ani = (Math.abs(a[i][(i - 1)]));
638                        }
639                        bni = 0.0;
640                        
641                        for (j = i; j < n; j++) {
642                                ani += Math.abs(a[i][j]);
643                                bni += Math.abs(b[i][j]);
644                        }
645        
646                        if (ani > anorm) {
647                                anorm = ani;
648                        }
649                        if (bni > bnorm) {
650                                bnorm = bni;
651                        }
652                }
653        
654                if (anorm == 0.0) {
655                        anorm = 1.0;
656                }
657                if (bnorm == 0.0) {
658                        bnorm = 1.0;
659                }
660        
661//              ep = eps1;
662//              if (ep == 0.0) {
663//                      // use round-off level if eps1 is zero
664//                      ep = epsilon(1.0);
665//              }
666                ep = (eps1 > 0) ? eps1 : epslon(1.0);
667                epsa = ep * anorm;
668                epsb = ep * bnorm;
669        
670                // rReduce a to quasi-triangular form, while keeping b triangular
671                lor1 = 0;
672                enorn = n;
673                en = n - 1;
674                itn = n * 30;
675                
676                // ------------------------------------------
677        
678                State state = State.L60;
679                StateLoop: while (state != State.Final) {
680                        switch (state) {
681        
682                        case L60: 
683                                // Begin QZ step
684                                if (en <= 1) {
685                                        state = State.L1001;
686                                        break;
687                                }
688                                if (!matz) {
689                                        enorn = en + 1;
690                                }
691                                its = 0;
692                                na = en - 1;
693                                enm2 = na;
694                                state = State.L70;
695                                break;
696        
697                        case L70:
698                                ish = 2;
699                                // check for convergence or reducibility.
700                                for (ll = 0; ll <= en; ++ll) {
701                                        lm1 = en - ll - 1;
702                                        l = lm1 + 1;
703                                        if (l == 0) {
704                                                state = State.L95;
705                                                continue StateLoop;             // check again!!
706                                        }
707                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= epsa) {
708                                                state = State.L90;
709                                                break;
710                                        }
711                                }
712                                state = State.L90;
713                                break;
714        
715                        case L90:
716                                a[l][lm1] = 0.0;
717                                if (l < na) {
718                                        state = State.L95;
719                                        break;
720                                }
721                                // 1-by-1 or 2-by-2 block isolated
722                                en = lm1;
723                                state = State.L60;
724                                break;
725        
726                        case L95: 
727                                // check for small top of b
728                                ld = l;
729                                state = State.L100;
730                                break;
731        
732                        case L100:
733                                l1 = l + 1;
734                                b11 = b[l][l];
735        
736                                if (Math.abs(b11) > epsb) {
737                                        state = State.L120;
738                                        break;
739                                }
740        
741                                b[l][l] = 0.0;
742                                s = Math.abs(a[l][l]) + Math.abs(a[l1][l]);
743                                u1 = a[l][l] / s;
744                                u2 = a[l1][l] / s;
745//                              r = Special.Sign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2), u1);
746                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
747                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
748                                v2 = -u2 / r;
749                                u2 = v2 / v1;
750        
751                                for (j = l; j < enorn; j++) {
752                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
753                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
754                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
755        
756                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
757                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
758                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
759                                }
760        
761                                if (l != 0) {
762                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
763                                }
764                                lm1 = l;
765                                l = l1;
766                                state = State.L90;
767                                break;
768        
769                        case L120:
770                                a11 = a[l][l] / b11;
771                                a21 = a[l1][l] / b11;
772                                if (ish == 1) {
773                                        state = State.L140;
774                                        break;
775                                }
776                                // iteration strategy
777                                if (itn == 0) {
778                                        state = State.L1000;
779                                        break;
780                                }
781                                if (its == 10) {
782                                        state = State.L155;
783                                        break;
784                                }
785        
786                                // determine type of shift
787                                b22 = b[l1][l1];
788                                if (Math.abs(b22) < epsb) {
789                                        b22 = epsb;
790                                }
791                                b33 = b[na][na];
792                                if (Math.abs(b33) < epsb) {
793                                        b33 = epsb;
794                                }
795                                b44 = b[en][en];
796                                if (Math.abs(b44) < epsb)
797                                        b44 = epsb;
798                                a33 = a[na][na] / b33;
799                                a34 = a[na][en] / b44;
800                                a43 = a[en][na] / b33;
801                                a44 = a[en][en] / b44;
802                                b34 = b[na][en] / b44;
803                                t = 0.5 * (a43 * b34 - a33 - a44);
804                                r = t * t + a34 * a43 - a33 * a44;
805                                if (r < 0.0) {
806                                        state = State.L150;
807                                        break;
808                                }
809        
810                                // determine single shift zero-th column of a
811                                ish = 1;
812                                r = Math.sqrt(r);
813                                sh = -t + r;
814                                s = -t - r;
815                                if (Math.abs(s - a44) < Math.abs(sh - a44)) {
816                                        sh = s;
817                                }
818        
819                                // look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements of a.
820                                for (ll = ld; ll < enm2; ll++) {
821                                        l = enm2 + ld - ll - 1;
822                                        if (l == ld) {
823                                                state = State.L140;
824                                                //break loop130;
825                                                continue StateLoop;
826                                        }
827                                        lm1 = l - 1;
828                                        l1 = l + 1;
829//                                      t = a[l + 1][l + 1];    // CHECK THIS!!
830                                        t = a[l][l];
831        
832                                        if (Math.abs(b[l][l]) > epsb) {
833                                                t = t - sh * b[l][l];
834                                        }
835        
836                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= Math.abs(t / a[l1][l]) * epsa) {
837                                                state = State.L100;
838                                                continue StateLoop;
839                                        }
840                                }
841                                state = State.L140;
842                                break;
843        
844                        case L140:
845                                a1 = a11 - sh;
846                                a2 = a21;
847                                if (l != ld) {
848                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
849                                }
850                                state = State.L160;
851                                break;
852        
853                        case L150: 
854                                // determine double shift zero-th column of a
855                                a12 = a[l][l1] / b22;
856                                a22 = a[l1][l1] / b22;
857                                b12 = b[l][l1] / b22;
858                                a1 = ((a33 - a11) * (a44 - a11) - a34 * a43 + a43 * b34 * a11) / a21 + a12 - a11 * b12;
859                                a2 = a22 - a11 - a21 * b12 - (a33 - a11) - (a44 - a11) + a43 * b34;
860                                a3 = a[l1 + 1][l1] / b22;
861                                state = State.L160;
862                                break;
863        
864                        case L155: 
865                                // ad hoc shift
866                                a1 = 0.0;
867                                a2 = 1.0;
868                                a3 = 1.1605;                    // magic!
869                                state = State.L160;
870                                break;
871        
872                        case L160:
873                                its = its + 1;
874                            itn = itn - 1;
875                                if (!matz) {
876                                        lor1 = ld;
877                                }
878        
879                                mainloop: for (k = l; k <= na; k++) {
880                                        notlas = (k != na && ish == 2);
881                                        k1 = k + 1;
882                                        k2 = k + 2;
883                                        km1 = Math.max(k, l + 1) - 1;
884                                        ll = Math.min(en, k1 + ish);
885        
886                                        if (!notlas) {
887                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1)
888                                                if (k != l) {
889                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
890                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
891                                                }
892        
893                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
894                                                if (s == 0.0) {
895                                                        state = State.L70;
896                                                        continue StateLoop;
897                                                }
898                                                u1 = a1 / s;
899                                                u2 = a2 / s;
900                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
901                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
902                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
903                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
904        
905                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
906                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j];
907                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
908                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
909        
910                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j];
911                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
912                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
913                                                }
914        
915                                                if (k != l) {
916                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
917                                                }
918                                                // goto L240;
919                                        }
920        
921                                        else {
922                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1) and a(k+2,k-1)
923                                                //L190:
924                                                if (k != l) {
925                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
926                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
927                                                        a3 = a[k2][km1];
928                                                }
929                                                //L200:
930                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2) + Math.abs(a3);
931                                                if (s == 0.0) {
932                                                        continue mainloop;      // goto L260;
933                                                }
934                                                u1 = a1 / s;
935                                                u2 = a2 / s;
936                                                u3 = a3 / s;
937                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
938                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
939                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
940                                                v3 = -u3 / r;
941                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
942                                                u3 = v3 / v1;
943        
944                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
945                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j] + u3 * a[k2][j];
946                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
947                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
948                                                        a[k2][j] = a[k2][j] + t * v3;
949        
950                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j] + u3 * b[k2][j];
951                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
952                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
953                                                        b[k2][j] = b[k2][j] + t * v3;
954                                                }
955        
956                                                if (k != l) {
957                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
958                                                        a[k2][km1] = 0.0;
959                                                }
960        
961                                                // zero b(k+2,k+1) and b(k+2,k)
962                                                s = Math.abs(b[k2][k2]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k1]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k]);
963                                                if (s != 0.0) {
964                                                        u1 = b[k2][k2] / s;
965                                                        u2 = b[k2][k1] / s;
966                                                        u3 = b[k2][k] / s;
967                                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
968                                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
969                                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
970                                                        v3 = -u3 / r;
971                                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
972                                                        u3 = v3 / v1;
973        
974                                                        for (i = lor1; i < ll + 1; i++) {
975                                                                t = a[i][k2] + u2 * a[i][k1] + u3 * a[i][k];
976                                                                a[i][k2] = a[i][k2] + t * v1;
977                                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v2;
978                                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v3;
979        
980                                                                t = b[i][k2] + u2 * b[i][k1] + u3 * b[i][k];
981                                                                b[i][k2] = b[i][k2] + t * v1;
982                                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v2;
983                                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v3;
984                                                        }
985        
986                                                        b[k2][k] = 0.0;
987                                                        b[k2][k1] = 0.0;
988        
989                                                        if (matz) {
990                                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
991                                                                        t = z[i][k2] + u2 * z[i][k1] + u3 * z[i][k];
992                                                                        z[i][k2] = z[i][k2] + t * v1;
993                                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v2;
994                                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v3;
995                                                                }
996                                                        }
997                                                }
998                                        }
999        
1000                                        // L240:
1001                                        // zero b(k+1,k)
1002                                        s = (Math.abs(b[k1][k1])) + (Math.abs(b[k1][k]));
1003                                        if (s == 0.0) {
1004                                                continue;       // goto L260;
1005                                        }
1006                                        u1 = b[k1][k1] / s;
1007                                        u2 = b[k1][k] / s;
1008                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1009                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1010                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1011                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1012        
1013                                        for (i = lor1; i <= ll; i++) {
1014                                                t = a[i][k1] + u2 * a[i][k];
1015                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v1;
1016                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v2;
1017        
1018                                                t = b[i][k1] + u2 * b[i][k];
1019                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v1;
1020                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v2;
1021                                        }
1022        
1023                                        b[k1][k] = 0.0;
1024        
1025                                        if (matz) {
1026                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1027                                                        t = z[i][k1] + u2 * z[i][k];
1028                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v1;
1029                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v2;
1030                                                }
1031                                        }
1032                                        // L260: ;
1033                                }
1034        
1035                                state = State.L70; // end qz step
1036                                break;
1037        
1038                        case L1000: 
1039                                // set error -- all eigenvalues have not converged after 30*n iterations
1040                                ierr = en + 1;
1041                                state = State.L1001;
1042                                break;
1043        
1044                        case L1001: 
1045                                // save epsb for use by qzval and qzvec
1046                                if (n > 1) {
1047                                        b[n - 1][0] = epsb;
1048                                }
1049                                state = State.Final;
1050                                break;
1051        
1052                        case Final:
1053                                throw new RuntimeException("this should never happen!");
1054                        }
1055                }
1056        
1057                return ierr;    // return eigenvalue index if iteration count exceeded
1058        } // end of qzit()
1059        
1060
1061        private enum State {
1062                L60, L70, L90, L95, L100, L120, L140, L150, L155, L160, L1000, L1001, Final;
1063        }
1064
1065        private static double EpsDouble;
1066        static {
1067                double eps;
1068                double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
1069                do {
1070                        double b = a - 1.0;
1071                        double c = b + b + b;
1072                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
1073                } while (eps == 0);
1074                EpsDouble = eps;
1075        }
1076        
1077        private static float EpsFloat;
1078        static {
1079                float eps;
1080                float a = 4.0f / 3.0f;
1081                do {
1082                        float b = a - 1.0f;
1083                        float c = b + b + b;
1084                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0f);
1085                } while (eps == 0);
1086                EpsFloat = eps;
1087        }
1088 
1089        /**
1090         * Estimates unit round-off in quantities of size x.
1091         * This is a port of the epsilon function from EISPACK.
1092         * See also
1093         * https://www.researchgate.net/publication/2860253_A_Comment_on_the_Eispack_Machine_Epsilon_Routine
1094         * 
1095         * @param x some quantity
1096         * @return returns the smallest number e of the same kind as x such that 1 + e > 1.
1097         */
1098        private static double epslon(double x) {
1099//              double eps;
1100//              double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
1101//              do {
1102//                      double b = a - 1.0;
1103//                      double c = b + b + b;
1104//                      eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
1105//              } while (eps == 0);
1106                return EpsDouble * Math.abs(x);
1107        }
1108        
1109        private static float epslon(float x) {
1110                return EpsFloat * Math.abs(x);
1111                
1112        }
1113        
1114/* original FORTRAN code:
1115           a = 4.0d0/3.0d0
1116        10 b = a - 1.0d0
1117           c = b + b + b
1118           eps = dabs(c-1.0d0)
1119           if (eps .eq. 0.0d0) go to 10
1120           epslon = eps*dabs(x)
1121           return
1122           end
1123*/
1124        
1125/*
1126program test_epsilon
1127    real :: x = 3.143
1128    real(8) :: y = 2.33
1129    print *, epsilon(x)
1130    print *, epsilon(y)
1131end program test_epsilon
1132 */
1133        
1134        public static void main(String[] args) {
1135                double x = 3.143;
1136                System.out.println(epslon(x));
1137                float y = 2.33f;
1138                System.out.println(epslon(y));
1139                
1140        }
1141
1142}
1143
1144//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1145
1146abstract class QZVAL {
1147
1148        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
1149
1150        /**
1151         * <p>
1152         * This subroutine is the third step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized
1153         * matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256 (1973) by Moler
1154         * and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the original version
1155         * (dated August 1983).
1156         * </p>
1157         * <p>
1158         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in
1159         * quasi-triangular form and the other in upper triangular form. it reduces the
1160         * quasi-triangular matrix further, so that any remaining 2-by-2 blocks
1161         * correspond to pairs of complex Eigenvalues, and returns quantities whose
1162         * ratios give the generalized eigenvalues. it is usually preceded by qzhes and
1163         * qzit and may be followed by qzvec.
1164         * </p>
1165         * <p>
1166         * On output:
1167         * </p>
1168         * <ul>
1169         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced further to a quasi-triangular matrix
1170         * in which all nonzero subdiagonal elements correspond to pairs of complex
1171         * eigenvalues.</li>
1172         * 
1173         * <li><strong>b</strong> is still in upper triangular form, although its
1174         * elements have been altered. b[n-1][0] is unaltered.</li>
1175         * 
1176         * <li><strong>alfr</strong> and <strong>alfi</strong> contain the real and
1177         * imaginary parts of the diagonal elements of the triangular matrix that would
1178         * be obtained if a were reduced completely to triangular form by unitary
1179         * transformations. Non-zero values of <strong>alfi</strong> occur in pairs, the
1180         * first member positive and the second negative.</li>
1181         * 
1182         * <li><strong>beta</strong> contains the diagonal elements of the corresponding
1183         * <strong>b</strong>, normalized to be real and non-negative. The generalized
1184         * eigenvalues are then the ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta).</li>
1185         * 
1186         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations
1187         * (for all three steps) if <strong>matz</strong> has been set to true.</li>
1188         * </ul>
1189         * 
1190         * @param a    contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.
1191         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix. In addition, location
1192         *             b[n-1][0] contains the tolerance quantity (epsb) computed and
1193         *             saved in qzit.
1194         * @param alfr and alfi contain the real and imaginary parts of the diagonal
1195         *             elements of the triangular matrix that would be obtained if a
1196         *             were reduced completely to triangular form by unitary
1197         *             transformations. Non-zero values of <strong>alfi</strong> occur
1198         *             in pairs, the first member positive and the second negative.
1199         * @param alfi see description for <strong>alfr</strong>.
1200         * @param beta contains the diagonal elements of the corresponding
1201         *             <strong>b</strong>, normalized to be real and non-negative. The
1202         *             generalized eigenvalues are then the ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta).
1203         * @param matz should be set to true. if the right hand transformations are to
1204         *             be accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to
1205         *             false otherwise.
1206         * @param z    contains, if <strong>matz</strong> has been set to true, the
1207         *             transformation matrix produced in the reductions by qzhes and
1208         *             qzit, if performed, or else the identity matrix. If
1209         *             <strong>matz</strong> has been set to false, z is not referenced.
1210         */
1211        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
1212        static void qzval(double[][] a, double[][] b, double[] alfr, double[] alfi, double[] beta, boolean matz,
1213                        double[][] z) {
1214
1215                final int n = a.length;
1216                
1217                int i = 0, j;
1218                int na = 0, en = 0, nn;
1219                double c = 0, d = 0, e = 0;
1220                double r, s, t;
1221                double a1 = 0, a2 = 0, u1, u2, v1, v2;
1222                double a11 = 0, a12 = 0, a21 = 0, a22 = 0;
1223                double b11 = 0, b12 = 0, b22 = 0;
1224                double di = 0, ei = 0;
1225                double an = 0, bn = 0;
1226                double cq = 0, dr = 0;
1227                double cz = 0, ti = 0, tr = 0;
1228                double a1i = 0, a2i = 0, a11i, a12i, a22i, a11r, a12r, a22r;
1229                double sqi = 0, ssi = 0, sqr = 0, szi = 0, ssr = 0, szr = 0;
1230
1231                double epsb = b[n - 1][0];
1232                int isw = 1;
1233
1234                // find eigenvalues of quasi-triangular matrices.
1235                for (nn = 0; nn < n; nn++) {
1236                        
1237                        State state = State.Linit;
1238                        StateLoop: while (state != State.Lfinal) {
1239                                
1240                                switch (state) {
1241                                case Linit:
1242                                        en = n - 1 - nn;        // TODO: check!!
1243                                        na = en - 1;
1244                                        if (isw == 2) {
1245                                                state = State.L505;
1246                                                break;
1247                                        }
1248                                        if (en == 0) {
1249                                                state = State.L410;
1250                                                break;
1251                                        }
1252                                        if (a[en][na] != 0.0) {
1253                                                state = State.L420;
1254                                                break;
1255                                        }
1256                                        state = State.L410;
1257                                        break;
1258
1259                                case L410:
1260                                        // 1-by-1 block, one real root
1261                                        alfr[en] = a[en][en];
1262                                        if (b[en][en] < 0.0) {
1263                                                alfr[en] = -alfr[en];
1264                                        }
1265                                        beta[en] = (Math.abs(b[en][en]));
1266                                        alfi[en] = 0.0;
1267                                        state = State.L510;
1268                                        break;
1269
1270                                case L420:
1271                                        // 2-by-2 block
1272                                        if (Math.abs(b[na][na]) <= epsb) {
1273                                                state = State.L455;
1274                                                break;
1275                                        }
1276                                        if (Math.abs(b[en][en]) > epsb) {
1277                                                state = State.L430;
1278                                                break;
1279                                        }
1280                                        a1 = a[en][en];
1281                                        a2 = a[en][na];
1282                                        bn = 0.0;
1283                                        state = State.L435;
1284                                        break;
1285
1286                                case L430:
1287                                        an = Math.abs(a[na][na]) + Math.abs(a[na][en]) + Math.abs(a[en][na]) + Math.abs(a[en][en]);
1288                                        bn = Math.abs(b[na][na]) + Math.abs(b[na][en]) + Math.abs(b[en][en]);
1289                                        a11 = a[na][na] / an;
1290                                        a12 = a[na][en] / an;
1291                                        a21 = a[en][na] / an;
1292                                        a22 = a[en][en] / an;
1293                                        b11 = b[na][na] / bn;
1294                                        b12 = b[na][en] / bn;
1295                                        b22 = b[en][en] / bn;
1296                                        e = a11 / b11;
1297                                        ei = a22 / b22;
1298                                        s = a21 / (b11 * b22);
1299                                        t = (a22 - e * b22) / b22;
1300
1301                                        if (Math.abs(e) > Math.abs(ei)) {
1302                                                e = ei;
1303                                                t = (a11 - e * b11) / b11;
1304                                        }
1305
1306                                        c = 0.5 * (t - s * b12);
1307                                        d = c * c + s * (a12 - e * b12);
1308
1309                                        if (d < 0.0) {
1310                                                state = State.L480;
1311                                                break;
1312                                        }
1313
1314                                        // two real roots. zero both a(en,na) and b(en,na)
1315                                        e = e + c + Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(d), c);
1316                                        a11 -= e * b11;
1317                                        a12 -= e * b12;
1318                                        a22 -= e * b22;
1319
1320                                        if (Math.abs(a11) + Math.abs(a12) < Math.abs(a21) + Math.abs(a22)) {
1321                                                a1 = a22;
1322                                                a2 = a21;
1323                                        } else {
1324                                                a1 = a12;
1325                                                a2 = a11;
1326                                        }
1327                                        state = State.L435;
1328                                        break;
1329
1330                                case L435:
1331                                        // choose and apply real z
1332                                        s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
1333                                        u1 = a1 / s;
1334                                        u2 = a2 / s;
1335                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1336                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1337                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1338                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1339
1340                                        for (i = 0; i <= en; i++) {             // TODO: check!
1341                                                t = a[i][en] + u2 * a[i][na];
1342                                                a[i][en] = a[i][en] + t * v1;
1343                                                a[i][na] = a[i][na] + t * v2;
1344
1345                                                t = b[i][en] + u2 * b[i][na];
1346                                                b[i][en] = b[i][en] + t * v1;
1347                                                b[i][na] = b[i][na] + t * v2;
1348                                        }       // L440
1349
1350                                        if (matz) {
1351                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1352                                                        t = z[i][en] + u2 * z[i][na];
1353                                                        z[i][en] = z[i][en] + t * v1;
1354                                                        z[i][na] = z[i][na] + t * v2;
1355                                                }       // L445
1356                                        }
1357
1358                                        // L450
1359                                        if (bn == 0.0) {
1360                                                state = State.L475;
1361                                                break;
1362                                        }
1363                                        if (an < Math.abs(e) * bn) {
1364                                                state = State.L455;
1365                                                break;
1366                                        }
1367                                        a1 = b[na][na];
1368                                        a2 = b[en][na];
1369                                        state = State.L460;
1370                                        break;
1371
1372                                case L455:
1373                                        a1 = a[na][na];
1374                                        a2 = a[en][na];
1375                                        state = State.L475;
1376                                        break;
1377
1378                                case L460:
1379                                        // choose and apply real q
1380                                        s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
1381                                        if (s == 0.0) {
1382                                                state = State.L475;
1383                                                break;
1384                                        }
1385                                        u1 = a1 / s;
1386                                        u2 = a2 / s;
1387                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1388                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1389                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1390                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1391
1392                                        for (j = na; j < n; j++) {
1393                                                t = a[na][j] + u2 * a[en][j];
1394                                                a[na][j] = a[na][j] + t * v1;
1395                                                a[en][j] = a[en][j] + t * v2;
1396
1397                                                t = b[na][j] + u2 * b[en][j];
1398                                                b[na][j] = b[na][j] + t * v1;
1399                                                b[en][j] = b[en][j] + t * v2;
1400                                        }       // L470
1401                                        
1402                                        state = State.L475;
1403                                        break;
1404
1405                                case L475:
1406                                        a[en][na] = 0.0;
1407                                        b[en][na] = 0.0;
1408                                        alfr[na] = a[na][na];
1409                                        alfr[en] = a[en][en];
1410
1411                                        if (b[na][na] < 0.0)
1412                                                alfr[na] = -alfr[na];
1413
1414                                        if (b[en][en] < 0.0)
1415                                                alfr[en] = -alfr[en];
1416
1417                                        beta[na] = (Math.abs(b[na][na]));
1418                                        beta[en] = (Math.abs(b[en][en]));
1419                                        alfi[en] = 0.0;
1420                                        alfi[na] = 0.0;
1421                                        state = State.L505;
1422                                        break;
1423
1424                                case L480:
1425                                        // two complex roots
1426                                        e = e + c;
1427                                        ei = Math.sqrt(-d);
1428                                        a11r = a11 - e * b11;
1429                                        a11i = ei * b11;
1430                                        a12r = a12 - e * b12;
1431                                        a12i = ei * b12;
1432                                        a22r = a22 - e * b22;
1433                                        a22i = ei * b22;
1434
1435                                        if (Math.abs(a11r) + Math.abs(a11i) + Math.abs(a12r) + Math.abs(a12i) < 
1436                                                Math.abs(a21) + Math.abs(a22r) + Math.abs(a22i)) {
1437                                                // L482;
1438                                                a1 = a22r;
1439                                                a1i = a22i;
1440                                                a2 = -a21;
1441                                                a2i = 0.0;
1442                                        } else {
1443                                                a1 = a12r;
1444                                                a1i = a12i;
1445                                                a2 = -a11r;
1446                                                a2i = -a11i;
1447                                        }
1448                                        // goto L485;
1449                                        state = State.L485;
1450                                        break;
1451
1452                                case L485:
1453                                        // choose complex z
1454                                        cz = Math.hypot(a1, a1i);
1455                                        if (cz == 0.0) {
1456                                                // L487
1457                                                szr = 1.0;
1458                                                szi = 0.0;
1459                                        } else {
1460                                                szr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cz;
1461                                                szi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cz;
1462                                                r = Math.sqrt(cz * cz + szr * szr + szi * szi);
1463                                                cz = cz / r;
1464                                                szr = szr / r;
1465                                                szi = szi / r;
1466                                        }
1467
1468                                        // L490:
1469                                        if (an < (Math.abs(e) + ei) * bn) {
1470                                                // L492
1471                                                a1 = cz * a11 + szr * a12;
1472                                                a1i = szi * a12;
1473                                                a2 = cz * a21 + szr * a22;
1474                                                a2i = szi * a22;
1475                                        } else {
1476                                                a1 = cz * b11 + szr * b12;
1477                                                a1i = szi * b12;
1478                                                a2 = szr * b22;
1479                                                a2i = szi * b22;
1480                                        }
1481
1482                                        // L495: choose complex q
1483                                        cq = Math.hypot(a1, a1i);
1484                                        if (cq == 0.0) {
1485                                                sqr = 1.0;
1486                                                sqi = 0.0;
1487                                        } else {
1488                                                sqr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cq;
1489                                                sqi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cq;
1490                                                r = Math.sqrt(cq * cq + sqr * sqr + sqi * sqi);
1491                                                cq = cq / r;
1492                                                sqr = sqr / r;
1493                                                sqi = sqi / r;
1494                                        }
1495
1496                                        // L500: compute diagonal elements that would result if transformations were applied
1497                                        ssr = sqr * szr + sqi * szi;
1498                                        ssi = sqr * szi - sqi * szr;
1499                                        i = 0;
1500                                        tr = cq * cz * a11 + cq * szr * a12 + sqr * cz * a21 + ssr * a22;
1501                                        ti = cq * szi * a12 - sqi * cz * a21 + ssi * a22;
1502                                        dr = cq * cz * b11 + cq * szr * b12 + ssr * b22;
1503                                        di = cq * szi * b12 + ssi * b22;
1504                                        state = State.L503;
1505                                        break;
1506
1507                                case L502:
1508                                        i = 1;
1509                                        tr = ssr * a11 - sqr * cz * a12 - cq * szr * a21 + cq * cz * a22;
1510                                        ti = -ssi * a11 - sqi * cz * a12 + cq * szi * a21;
1511                                        dr = ssr * b11 - sqr * cz * b12 + cq * cz * b22;
1512                                        di = -ssi * b11 - sqi * cz * b12;
1513                                        state = State.L503;
1514                                        break;
1515
1516                                case L503:
1517                                        t = ti * dr - tr * di;
1518                                        j = na;
1519                                        if (t < 0.0) {
1520                                                j = en;
1521                                        }
1522                                        r = Math.hypot(dr, di);
1523                                        beta[j] = bn * r;
1524                                        alfr[j] = an * (tr * dr + ti * di) / r;
1525                                        alfi[j] = an * t / r;
1526                                        if (i == 0) {
1527                                                // goto L502;
1528                                                state = State.L502;
1529                                                break;
1530                                        }
1531                                        state = State.L505;
1532                                        break;
1533
1534                                case L505:
1535                                        isw = 3 - isw;
1536                                        state = State.L510;
1537                                        break;
1538
1539                                case L510:
1540                                        state = State.Lfinal;
1541                                        break;
1542
1543                                case Lfinal:
1544                                        throw new RuntimeException("this should never happen!");
1545                                        //                                      break StateLoop;
1546                                }
1547                        }       // end StateLoop: while (state
1548
1549                }       // L510 end for (nn ..
1550
1551                b[n - 1][0] = epsb;
1552                
1553        } // end of qzval()
1554
1555        private enum State {
1556                Linit, Lfinal, L505, L410, L420, L455, L430, L435, L480, L475, L485, L503, L502, L460, L510
1557        }
1558
1559}
1560
1561//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1562
1563abstract class QZVEC {
1564        
1565        public static boolean VERBOSE = false;
1566
1567        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
1568
1569        /**
1570         * <p>
1571         * This subroutine is the optional fourth step of the qz algorithm for solving
1572         * generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256
1573         * (1973) by Moler and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the
1574         * original version (dated August 1983).
1575         * </p>
1576         * <p>
1577         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in
1578         * quasi-triangular form (in which each 2-by-2 block corresponds to a pair of
1579         * complex eigenvalues) and the other in upper triangular form. It computes the
1580         * eigenvectors of the triangular problem and transforms the results back to the
1581         * original coordinate system. It is usually preceded by qzhes, qzit, and qzval.
1582         * </p>
1583         * <p>
1584         * On output:
1585         * </p>
1586         * <ul>
1587         * <li><strong>a</strong> is unaltered. Its subdiagonal elements provide
1588         * information about the storage of the complex eigenvectors.</li>
1589         * 
1590         * <li><strong>b</strong> has been destroyed.</li>
1591         * 
1592         * <li><strong>alfr</strong>, <strong>alfi</strong> and <strong>beta</strong>
1593         * are unaltered.</li>
1594         * 
1595         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the real and imaginary parts of the
1596         * eigenvectors. If alfi(i) = 0.0, the i-th eigenvalue is real and the i-th
1597         * column of z contains its eigenvector. if alfi(i) &ne; 0.0, the i-th
1598         * eigenvalue is complex. if alfi(i) &gt; 0.0, the eigenvalue is the first of a
1599         * complex pair and the i-th and (i+1)-th columns of z contain its eigenvector.
1600         * if alfi(i) &lt; 0.0, the eigenvalue is the second of a complex pair and the
1601         * (i-1)-th and i-th columns of z contain the conjugate of its eigenvector. Each
1602         * eigenvector is normalized so that the modulus of its largest component is
1603         * 1.0.</li>
1604         * </ul>
1605         * 
1606         * @param a    contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.
1607         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix. In addition, location
1608         *             b[n-1][0] contains the tolerance quantity (epsb) computed and
1609         *             saved in qzit.
1610         * @param alfr , <strong>alfi</strong>, and <strong>beta</strong> are vectors
1611         *             with components whose ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta) are the
1612         *             generalized eigenvalues. They are usually obtained from qzval.
1613         * @param alfi see <strong>alfr</strong>
1614         * @param beta see <strong>alfr</strong>
1615         * @param z    contains the transformation matrix produced in the reductions by
1616         *             qzhes, qzit, and qzval, if performed. If the eigenvectors of the
1617         *             triangular problem are desired, z must contain the identity
1618         *             matrix.
1619         */
1620        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
1621        static void qzvec(double[][] a, double[][] b, double[] alfr, double[] alfi, double[] beta, double[][] z) {
1622
1623                final int n = a.length;
1624
1625                int i = 0, j, k, m;
1626                int na = 0, ii, en = 0, jj, nn, enm2;
1627                double d = 0, q;
1628                double r = 0, s = 0, t = 0, w = 0, x = 0, y = 0, t1 = 0, t2 = 0, w1 = 0, x1 = 0, z1 = 0, di = 0;
1629                double ra = 0, dr = 0, sa = 0;
1630                double ti = 0, rr, tr = 0, zz = 0;
1631                double alfm, almi, betm, almr;
1632
1633                double epsb = b[n - 1][0];
1634                int isw = 1;
1635
1636                if (VERBOSE) System.out.println("QZVEC: starting Loop A ***********************");
1637                LoopA: for (nn = 0; nn < n; nn++) {
1638
1639                        StateA stateA = StateA.Ainit;
1640                        StateLoopA: while (stateA != StateA.Afinal) {
1641
1642                                switch(stateA) {
1643                                case Ainit :
1644                                        en = n - 1 - nn;        // TODO: check!!
1645                                        na = en - 1;
1646                                        if (isw == 2) {
1647                                                stateA = StateA.A795;
1648                                                break;
1649                                        }
1650                                        if (alfi[en] != 0.0) {
1651                                                stateA = StateA.A710;
1652                                                break;
1653                                        }
1654
1655                                        // Real vector
1656                                        m = en;
1657                                        b[en][en] = 1.0;
1658                                        if (na == -1) {
1659                                                stateA = StateA.A800;
1660                                                break;
1661                                        }
1662                                        alfm = alfr[m];
1663                                        betm = beta[m];
1664
1665                                        if (VERBOSE) System.out.println("QZVEC: starting Loop B ***********************");
1666                                        
1667                                        // for i=en-1 step -1 until 1 do --
1668                                        LoopB: for (ii = 0; ii <= na; ii++) {
1669                                                
1670                                                StateB stateB = StateB.Binit;
